Languages: Understands all languages it knew in life but cannot speak

Traits.Name: Memory Fog
Traits.Content: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the Hollow File must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or loses all short-term memory for 1 minute, forgetting the name and purpose of objects and creatures it is interacting with.

Traits.Name: Evasive Presence
Traits.Content: The swarm's near-transparent form grants it advantage on Dexterity saving throws against attacks or effects that rely on sight.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The Hollow File makes two attacks: one with its Memory Shred and one with its Obfuscate Strike.

Actions.Name: Memory Shred
Actions.Content: Melee Attack: +5 to hit, dealing 7 (1d8 + 3) psychic damage. On a hit, the target must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or take an additional 3 (1d6) psychic damage and suffer disadvantage on Intelligence checks until the end of its next turn.

Actions.Name: Obfuscate Strike
Actions.Content: Ranged Attack: +5 to hit, dealing 7 (1d8 + 3) force damage. On a hit, the targetâ€™s memory is briefly obscured. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be confused until the end of its next turn, treating allies as enemies.

Actions.Name: File Obliteration
Actions.Content: The Hollow File releases a wave of memory-erasing energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw, taking 30 (4d12 + 4) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This action can be used once and recharges after a short or long rest. A creature that fails the save has its memories of the last hour erased.
